It was nice, but I don't think it was her brother calling her at the end. There are no clues pointing at that, and also it wouldn't make much sense. If her brother were alive, then why would she need to create that memory pill? And yes, it seems that she was just dreaming, and the pill allowed her to control her dreams, that's why in chapter 2 she says that she's the one that controls when to rewind time. It's not about her being raped or not. She wanted to give up in ch2, but decided to endure it because she thought it was the only way to keep her brother alive, but in this chapter her brother told her that he's not happy with this, that he can see she's suffering being trapped in her own dream. It's not obvious but it seems they had that conversation a lot of times, that's why we see her brother tied up to that chair and his sister in front of him with some clothes on, even though we clearly saw her naked in the previous panels

It's not until her brother shouted at her again, and that finally "wake her up" and she sees that she's not making any of them happy. It's really tragic because it seems that her brother had the same feelings for her, or maybe she was kind of influencing him to develop those feelings. We'll never know. But at least in the end she accepts that he's dead and move on, I guess that's why we see, probably her father calling her, calling her at the end.

My theory is that she actually doesn't create a time travel drug and the drug itself more a kind a drug that would make the user can control their dream without knowing if they are in a state of dreaming. When in dream people doesn't aware that they are in the state of dreaming and cannot control the story of their dreams. But if they aware they're in state of dreaming, they could control their dream. The problem with this method is Kusuha mind/sub-consciousness cannot make a dream where her brother still alive, even after she change the past the brother will die no matter what because her mind cannot projecting a dream where her brother still alive. In this chapter, after many rewinding dream her sub-consciousness realize that what happen to Kusuha would make her brother sad so her sub-consciousness make a dream where brother have Kusuha memory and in result force Kusuha to wake up and move on from the past. If my theory is true then whoever called her in the ending isn't her brother.

And so, mission Accomplished. What has started with a premise as an incest-rape doujin, evolved into a story lifted straight from Groundhog Day, and with a love that even trancends death.. connects into a time loop that will give Edge of Tomorrow a run for its money. And on the bright side.. i think it was implied, that the very last fuck, undo the death flag. She somehow beats Death in its own game, denying the Final Destination fate of her bro, and now has become *her presumed Husband/close partner*. Will she uses her time medicine for something else entirely? Its up to her and her hubby. What a way to end the tri-chapter story of Time-Queen Sister and her beloved Step-Bro
